summary: Temperature tells us how hot or cold something is. It's measured with a thermometer and shows the energy of atoms in a substance. There are different ways to measure temperature, like Celsius (°C), Fahrenheit (°F), and Kelvin (K). Kelvin is used in science, and absolute zero (-273.15°C) is the coldest it can get. Temperature is crucial in science and everyday life, affecting everything from weather to how our bodies work.
title: Temperature
